Name:
Albrighton
Raule
Identification:
Pennant number: L12
Pennant number: F217
Fate:
Sold to West Germany, 11 November 1957
Sold for scrap, 1969
Displacement:
1,050 long tons (1,070 t) standard,
1,490 long tons (1,510 t) full load
Propulsion:
2 Admiralty 3-drum boilers
2 shaft Parsons geared turbines, 19,000 shp (14,000 kW)
Range: 3,700 nmi (6,900 km; 4,300 mi) at 14 knots (26 km/h; 16 mph)
Armament:
4 × QF 4 in Mark XVI guns on twin mounts Mk. XIX
5 × QF 2 pdr Mk. VIII (1 × quad mount and 1 × single bow chaser mount)
3 × 20 mm Oerlikons
2 × 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes
70 depth charges, 4 throwers, 2 racks
